benchmark_details.name: Compound-QA
benchmark_details.overview: Compound-QA is a benchmark focusing on evaluating large language models (LLMs) on their ability to answer compound questions that include multiple sub-questions. It consists of 1,500 compound questions created from existing QA datasets, aiming to assess understanding, reasoning, and knowledge.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of the Compound-QA benchmark is to evaluate the capability of LLMs in handling compound questions containing multiple sub-questions.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset is based on existing datasets and is limited to English.

data.source: The dataset is derived from existing QA datasets using a synthesis framework called CQ-Syn, incorporating human verification for quality control.
data.annotation: Annotated with proprietary LLMs and verified by humans for accuracy.

methodology.calculation: The win rate indicates the proportion of instances where the modelâ€™s answers are as good as or better than the reference answers in terms of quality.
methodology.interpretation: Higher win rates indicate better performance of the models on compound questions.
methodology.baseline_results: Performance of eight open-source LLMs evaluated on compound questions.
methodology.validation: Manual verification by graduate-level students to ensure accurate and high-quality data.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Released under the CC BY-SA 4.0 license.
